result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sherman Davion Wilks II

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sherman Davion Wilks II not in court, in custody.  Attorney Claire E Zyber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status of counsel.  No attorney has been appointed yet. Case is adjourned to 11-8-22 at 1:30 pm for an Order to Show Cause hearing as to why an attorney has not been appointed yet by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sherman Davion Wilks II appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. appeared by video for Sherman Davion Wilks II.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Final Pre-Trial. Attorney Klimetz informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable, due to discrepancies with retainer fees.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Court further vacates 10/24/2022 jury trial date and adjourns case for status of counsel to Br 10.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sherman Davion Wilks II appeared by video.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. appeared by video for Sherman Davion Wilks II.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Final Pre-Trial. Due to court congestion, court passes case to 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed. STATES WITNESS LIST

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Sherman Davion Wilks not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for status conference.  Court sets final pretrial and jury trial dates.  The final pretrial will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616.  Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Sherman Davion Wilks not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference. Case is adjourned to 7-19-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Sherman Davion Wilks not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sherman Davion Wilks in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Sherman Davion Wilks in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 10, Judge Havas. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 029413,
Payable Number: 994345,
Receipt Number: 22RP011664,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Sherman Davion Wilks not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Cleghorn to be appointed in this matter, but is unable to appear today. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with L.M.W and A.C
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order and limited curfew (8pm-7am). If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Sherman Davion Wilks in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Sherman Davion Wilks in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sherman Davion Wilks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10. As to count 10: Court orally amends "use of a dangerous weapon" enhancer (939.63(1)(a)) to (939.63(1)(b)).   Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 3, 8, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, and 19.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Br 10.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
